body_html: @ezyang I feel that splitting up all the tests and putting them in a test directory might also be a bit too complicated, and currently we don't need to parallelize them at that granularity yet. I refactored the change a bit to get rid of the SPLIT_TESTS variable and made the branching logic a bit simpler. It should be pretty readable and easy to understand now.
body_text: @ezyang I feel that splitting up all the tests and putting them in a test directory might also be a bit too complicated, and currently we don't need to parallelize them at that granularity yet. I refactored the change a bit to get rid of the SPLIT_TESTS variable and made the branching logic a bit simpler. It should be pretty readable and easy to understand now.
body: @ezyang I feel that splitting up all the tests and putting them in a `test` directory might also be a bit too complicated, and currently we don't need to parallelize them at that granularity yet. I refactored the change a bit to get rid of the `SPLIT_TESTS` variable and made the branching logic a bit simpler. It should be pretty readable and easy to understand now.
